answerText: Alcestis[10] This play ends when Talthybius brings the body of Hector's son Astyanax to Hecuba, who buries it for Andromache. This play describes the post-war fate of a group of people including Andromache and Cassandra.
heading: Western Invitational Tournament |2013 | Bentley Gioia Hunter Lopez-Lago | 20 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name some plays by Euripides, for 10 points each. [10] In this play, Heracles arrives at the palace of Admetus after the title character's death and forces Admetus to break a promise to refrain from merrymaking. Heracles ambushes Thanatos and resurrects the title character.
